article.headline: Hofstra 76, Binghamton 63
article.story: BINGHAMTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Antonie Agudio scored 22 points to lead Hofstra to a 76-63 win Saturday over Binghamton. Loren Stokes pulled down a game-high nine rebounds for Hofstra (3-0). Aurimas Kieza scored 19 points and Loren Stokes added 18 for the Pride. Andre Heard scored 14 points and Sebastian Hermenier grabbed six rebounds For Binghamton (1-3). Binghamton built an early 14-5 lead. But the Bearcats then missed 10 consecutive shots, opening the door for Hofstra. The Pride shot 50 percent in the first half and used a 12-3 run to grab a 34-31 lead at halftime. Binghamton made just two field goals in the the final 10:39 of the half. Hofstra opened the second half with a 20-8 run to stretch its lead to 15. The Bearcats twice pulled to within seven, but Hofstra made seven free throws in the final 4:10 to seal the win.
